review: It was a little easier to set up than I expected after reading some reviews.  I was disappointed to discover that the movies are periodically interrupted and the picture quality varies during the same film.  I expected better viewing quality.  Also, I thought I could view episodes of current TV shows, it appears I only have access to past seasons.  That's very disappointing.  I'm a Prime member, but there is still a lot that I have to pay to see. I was hoping to reduce my cable bill, but I don't think Amazon Fire was the right choice.
author: Rose Boyd

review: This thing is awesome!  I have a few Chromecasts around the house and I very mistakenly believed they served the same purpose!  Boy was I wrong!  This is a full computer! It replaced my XBMC PC as it can run XBMC/Kodi even better than my PC.  Once I had it running I realized that with the great remote and the excellent performance, I could sell all my other devices and the stick and fireTV is all I needed!  Great product!

author: BRP

review: Love, love, love it! I've been an Apple TV guy for several years, in fact I have 3 of them.  Two things have made me abandon Apple TV however.  Plex and Pandora!  I've recently transitioned from iTunes to Plex for my personal movie collection (about 6TB of video).  Plex puts iTunes to shame and unfortunately, Apple TV does not offer Plex.  Then there's Pandora.  I love Pandora and have regretted not having that on my Apple TV.  I've gotten around that by pulling up Pandora on my phone or iPad and beaming to Apple TV, but it's so much more convenient to just have the app on the TV to start with.  Anyway, I'm now fully in the Amazon Fire TV camp and will never look back to Apple TV.  The voice command on the Fire is also cool and works great.  I wish it worked for my personal video collection as well, but it doesn't. That's my only criticism of Fire TV.
